data.title: Ubuntu Sources List Generator
data.meta_description: Sources List Generator for Ubuntu, Xubuntu, Kubuntu, Edubuntu, Ubuntu Server and other Ubuntu-based distros. It features the official Canonical one repositories as well as other 3rd party repos.
data.text:
Playdeb

Playdeb is a gaming repository for Ubuntu - aimed to provide titles already available on getdeb.net in an easier to install and update format.

Wicd

Wicd is an open source wired and wireless network manager for Linux which aims to provide a simple interface to connect to networks with a wide variety of settings.

Wine

Wine is an Open Source implementation of the Windows API on top of X, OpenGL, and Unix.

KDE 4.1.2

KDE 4.1.2 has been released and packages are available for Kubuntu 8.04, the Hardy Heron. These packages install to /usr/lib/kde4 and can be installed along side your existing KDE 3 installation.

Google Linux Software Repositories

Google's Linux software repositories make it easier to download and stay up-to-date with current releases of Google Linux applications. Please choose one of the guides below to help configure your system to use these repositories.

Medibuntu

Medibuntu (Multimedia, Entertainment & Distractions In Ubuntu) is a repository of packages that cannot be included into the Ubuntu distribution for legal reasons (copyright, license, patent, etc).

KDE 4.2 PPA Repos

KDE 4.2 has been released. Packages for 8.10 (Intrepid) are in the kubuntu-experimental PPA.

Amarok 2 - Project Neon

Project Neon is the codename for an Amarok internal all mighty project, aiming to provide nightly binary packages of the most recent Amarok code base. It makes the current development easily available for everyone.

Banshee

This PPA contains the latest debs of Banshee for Ubuntu.

VirtualBox

VirtualBox is a general-purpose full virtualizer for x86 hardware. Targeted at server, desktop and embedded use, it is now the only professional-quality virtualization solution that is also Open Source Software.

OpenOffice.org 3.0

PPA for OpenOffice.org Scribblers

Deluge BitTorrent

Deluge is a full-featured BitTorrent client for Linux, Unix. Deluge features a rich plugin collection; in fact, most of Deluge's functionality is available in the form of plugins.

Opera

Opera is the only Web browser that comes complete with everything you need to be fast, safe and productive online.

Ubuntu Tweak

Ubuntu Tweak is an application designed to config Ubuntu easier for everyone. It provides many useful desktop and system options that are not provided in the default desktop environment. At present, it is only designed for Ubuntu GNOME Desktop.

Gwibber

Gwibber is an open source microblogging client for GNOME developed with Python and GTK. It supports Twitter, Jaiku, Identi.ca, Facebook, Flickr, Digg, and RSS. Please note that this is roughly beta-quality software.

Cairo Dock

Cairo Dock is a Mac-like Dock used for applets as well as application launching

Skype

Skype is proprietary software that allows you to make calls over the Internet using your computer. Skype uses VOIP

Abiword

AbiWord is a free word processing program similar to Microsoft® Word. It is suitable for a wide variety of word processing tasks.

Gnome-Do

GNOME Do allows you to quickly search for many items present on your desktop or the web, and perform useful actions on those items. GNOME Do is inspired by Quicksilver & GNOME Launch Box.

AWN (Avant Window Navigator) Testing Packages

Avant Window Navigator (AWN/Awn) is a dock-like navigation bar for the linux desktop that positions itself at the bottom of the screen. It can be used to keep track of open windows and behaves like a normal window list.

Chromium Project

Chromium is the open-source project behind Google Chrome. The PPA is maintained by a bot, so it contains completely untested builds, mostly useful to track regressions or if you are curious, or just brave.

Oracle Database 10g Express Edition

The Express Edition of the Oracle 10g DB restricted to a single CPU, a maximum of 4 GB of user data and 1 GB of memory

Tor: anonymity online

Tor is a software project that helps you defend against traffic analysis, a form of network surveillance that threatens personal freedom and privacy, confidential business activities and relationships, and state security. Tor protects you by bouncing your communications around a distributed network of relays run by volunteers all around the world: it prevents somebody watching your Internet connection from learning what sites you visit, and it prevents the sites you visit from learning your physical location. Tor works with many of your existing applications, including web browsers, instant messaging clients, remote login, and other applications based on the TCP protocol.

Exaile

Exaile is a music manager and player for GTK+ written in Python. It incorporates automatic fetching of album art, handling of large libraries, lyrics fetching, artist/album information via Wikipedia, Last.fm submission support, and optional iPod support via a plugin.

SMPlayer

SMPlayer intends to be a complete front-end for MPlayer, from basic features like playing videos, DVDs, and VCDs to more advanced features like support for MPlayer filters and more.

Mozilla Daily Build Team

This PPA contains daily builds (or even multiple builds per day) for various mozilla projects and branches. Notably: Firefox, Prism, Thunderbird and Xulrunner.

LMMS - Linux MultiMedia Studio

LMMS is a free cross-platform alternative to commercial programs like FL Studio®, which allow you to produce music with your computer. This includes the creation of melodies and beats, the synthesis and mixing of sounds, and arranging of samples. You can have fun with your MIDI-keyboard and much more; all in a user-friendly and modern interface.

PlayOnLinux

PlayOnLinux is a piece of software which allows you to easily install and use numerous games and softwares designed to run with Microsoft®'s Windows®.

KDE 3.5

Maintainers of KDE3.5 for Ubuntu Intrepid and above. Emphasis is placed on keeping KDE3.5 as a viable Ubuntu desktop environment, easily installed and used alongside others, just like Gnome, XFCE, and KDE4.x.

Google Linux Software Repositories (testing)

The Google Testing Repository has more up-to-date software than the stable one. Use this repository only in ADDITION to the stable one (both are required). Should you run into an issue or two then please report the problem with the link given on the HowTo page.

Kubuntu Experimental

Testing ground for Kubuntu packages.

Kubuntu Updates

Updates for Kubuntu releases which are due to go to Ubuntu Updates. Mostly KDE point releases.

X Updates

Updated versions of X.org drivers, libraries, etc. for Ubuntu. This PPA is for stable upstream releases of X.org components.

FreeNX

NX is an exciting new technology for remote display. It provides near local speed application responsiveness over high latency, low bandwidth links. The core libraries for NX are provided by NoMachine under the GPL. FreeNX is a GPL implementation of the NX Server and NX Client Components.

origami

Origami eases the installation, management and monitoring of running Stanford's Folding at Home distributed computing project on Linux clients. This project simply makes running the project on a Linux machine more "native". For more information on Stanford's distributed computing research project please see: http://folding.stanford.edu

Vuze

Vuze (formerly Azureus) is a free BitTorrent client used to transfer files via the BitTorrent protocol. Vuze is written in Java, and uses the Azureus Engine. In addition to bittorrenting, Vuze allows users to view, publish and share original DVD and HD quality video content.

Ubuntu Netbook Remix

Ubuntu Netbook Remix is a 'remix' of the standard Ubuntu Desktop release to enable it to work better on devices with small screens, such as Netbooks (sub-notebooks).

XBMC Media Center

XBMC is an award winning media center application for Linux, Mac OS X, Windows and XBox. The ultimate hub for all your media, XBMC is easy to use, looks slick, and has a large helpful community.

Array.org Netbook Repository

Within this repository you find a selection of customized Netbook kernel packages and support utilities designed specifically for Ubuntu Linux and your Asus Eee PC, Acer Aspire One, MSI Wind, Dell Mini 9, or HP Mini device.

Array.org Netbook Repository (Proposed)

Within this repository you find a selection of customized Netbook kernel packages and support utilities designed specifically for Ubuntu Linux and your Asus Eee PC, Acer Aspire One, MSI Wind, Dell Mini 9, or HP Mini device. The Hardy Proposed repo requires to have also enabled the Hardy repo.

Array.org Netbook Repository (Proposed)

Within this repository you find a selection of customized Netbook kernel packages and support utilities designed specifically for Ubuntu Linux and your Asus Eee PC, Acer Aspire One, MSI Wind, Dell Mini 9, or HP Mini device. The Intrepid Proposed repo also requires the Intrepid repo to be added.

VLC & X264

This PPA contains up-to-date VLC & x264 packages.

WxWidgets

Latest WxWidget Versions

VLC Media Player

VLC media player - the cross-platform media player and streaming server. VLC media player is a highly portable multimedia player for various audio and video formats (MPEG-1, MPEG-2, MPEG-4, DivX, mp3, ogg, ...) as well as DVDs, VCDs, and various streaming protocols. It can also be used as a server to stream in unicast or multicast in IPv4 or IPv6 on a high-bandwidth network.

Kubuntu Experimental

Testing ground for unfinished Kubuntu packages.

PPA for Kiwi Linux Members

Kiwi Linux is an Ubuntu derivative primarily made for Romanian, Hungarian and English speaking users. Kiwi Linux is slightly a modified Ubuntu Desktop/Install CD for the i386 architecture, that is in sync with Ubuntu's release cycles and uses its package archives. Hence it is easy to switch to and from Ubuntu and all the security and bugfix updates from Ubuntu are getting into Kiwi Linux automatically.

Conky

Conky is an advanced, highly configurable system monitor for X based on torsmo.

Kadu

Kadu is an open source gadu-gadu protocol instant messenger client for Linux, BSD and Mac.

Blueman

Blueman is a GTK+ Bluetooth Manager.Blueman is designed to provide simple, yet effective means for controlling BlueZ API and simplifying bluetooth tasks such as , Connecting to 3G/EDGE/GPRS via dial-up, Connecting to/Creating bluetooth networks, Connecting to input devices, Connecting to audio devices, Sending/Receiving/Browsing files via OBEX, Pairing. Blueman also integrates with Network Manager 0.7, so any Dialup/Network connections will be made available (via HAL) to Network Manager.

GNOME-Colors PPA

This PPA will provide backports of the most up-to-date GNOME-Colors and Shiki-Colors packages.

Themes for GNOME and Ubuntu

Themes for GNOME and Ubuntu

Miro HD Video Player

Miro is a free HD video player. It can play almost any video file and offers over 6,000 free internet TV shows and video podcasts. Miro has a simple, gorgeous interface designed for fullscreen HD video. Since Miro downloads most videos, you can take your shows with you, even on an airplane. Quite simply, Miro is a better way to watch all the video you care about.

Blueman

Blueman is a GTK+ Bluetooth Manager. Blueman is designed to provide simple, yet effective means for controlling BlueZ API and simplifying bluetooth tasks such as , Connecting to 3G/EDGE/GPRS via dial-up, Connecting to/Creating bluetooth networks, Connecting to input devices, Connecting to audio devices, Sending/Receiving/Browsing files via OBEX, Pairing. Blueman also integrates with Network Manager 0.7, so any Dialup/Network connections will be made available (via HAL) to Network Manager.

Quantum GIS

Official stable Quantum GIS (QGIS) packages

Enna

Enna is a Media Center application. Featuring a simple user interface. Enna is based on the powerful Enlightenment Foundations Libraries (EFL) as for its graphical user interface and GeeXboX libraries as for multimedia playback and information retrieval.

Terminator

Terminator, multiple terminals in one window. The goal of this project is to produce a useful tool for arranging terminals. It is inspired by programs such as gnome-multi-term, quadkonsole, etc. in that the main focus is arranging terminals in grids (tabs is the most common default method, which Terminator also supports).

Esmska

Program for sending SMS over the Internet. It uses publicly available web gateways and sends messages through them. This way it can be much more comfortable than using a web browser or a mobile phone.

Emesene

Emesene is a python/Gtk Instant Messenger for the Windows Live Messenger network.

muCommander

muCommander is a lightweight, cross-platform file manager with a dual-pane interface. It runs on any operating system with Java support (Mac OS X, Windows, Linux, *BSD, Solaris...).

Fritz Fun (ffgtk)

Fritz Fun (ffgtk) is a clean solution for controlling the FRITZ!Box or compatible router with Linux. It offers a rich feature list, including caller monitor and fax support.

OpenShot

Open-source, non-linear video editor for Linux

MediaInfo

MediaInfo supplies technical and tag information about a video or audio file. It is free software (free of charge and free access to source code: GPL or LGPL licence)

Pidgin

Pidgin is an easy to use and free chat client used by millions. Connect to AIM, MSN, Yahoo, and more chat networks all at once. Supported chat networks: * AIM * Bonjour * Gadu-Gadu * Google Talk * Groupwise * ICQ * IRC * MSN * MySpaceIM * QQ * SILC * SIMPLE * Sametime * XMPP * Yahoo! * Zephyr

KMess

KMess, the Live/MSN Messenger alternative for Linux. With KMess, chatting with friends using Live Messenger has never been so good.

Kubuntu Backports

Backports of new versions of KDE for Kubuntu which are not yet tested enough to go to Ubuntu Backports.

qutIM

Free open-source multiprotocol ( ICQ, Jabber/ GTalk/Ya.Online/LiveJournal.com, Mail.Ru, IRC ) instant messenger for Windows and Linux systems.

qutIM (SVN)

Free open-source multiprotocol ( ICQ, Jabber/ GTalk/Ya.Online/LiveJournal.com, Mail.Ru, IRC ) instant messenger for Windows and Linux systems.

Breathe Icon Set

A new effort to create a set of icons mixing the modern style of KDEs "Oxygen" icons with Ubuntu's "Human" set.

GetDeb

GetDeb is an unofficial project with the mission to provide the latest open source and freeware applications for the current Ubuntu Linux release, in an easy to install manner.

Dropbox

Dropbox is software that syncs your files online and across your computers. The free Dropbox account comes with 2GB of space that you can use for as long as you like. If you need more than 2GB of space there are commercial plans that offer up to 100GB storage space.

HandBrake

HandBrake is an open-source, GPL-licensed, multiplatform, multithreaded video transcoder, available for MacOS X, Linux and Windows.

BaShare

BaShare (Basic Share) is a very simply and user-friendly file sharing tool over the Internet and private LAN too. Basically BaShare is a http server with a graphical user interface (GUI). Select a file, give the link to your friends and they will be able to download the file from you speedily (or not, as you wish :-) ) BaShare is very useful during chat sessions!

Freeswitch Nightly Drivers

FreeSWITCH is a scalable open source cross-platform telephony platform designed to route and interconnect popular communication protocols using audio, video, text or any other form of media. It was created in 2006 to fill the void left by proprietary commercial solutions. FreeSWITCH also provides a stable telephony platform on which many telephony applications can be developed using a wide range of free tools.

Kubuntu Beta

The Kubuntu Team has released the second beta of KDE SC 4.4 their Beta PPA.

Mendeley Desktop

Organize, share, and discover research papers! Mendeley is a research management tool for desktop & web. You can also explore research trends and connect to other academics in your discipline.

Kubuntu Experimental

Testing ground for unfinished Kubuntu packages - use with caution!

Ailurus

Ailurus is an application which aims at making Linux easier to use. It help users study some Linux skills, installs/removes some applications which are not provided in the official repository, enables/disables some third party repositories etc.

SABnzbd

SABnzbd is an Open Source Binary Newsreader written in Python. It's totally free, incredibly easy to use, and works practically everywhere.SABnzbd makes Usenet as simple and streamlined as possible by automating everything we can. All you have to do is add an .nzb. SABnzbd takes over from there, where it will be automatically downloaded, verified, repaired, extracted and filed away with zero human interaction.

Webmin

Webmin is a web-based interface for system administration for Unix.

Yuuguu

A free screen sharing tool for everyone. Instant web-conferencing, online meetings and collaboration.

Wine

Wine is an Open Source implementation of the Windows API on top of X, OpenGL, and Unix. With this PPA you can get the latest available Wine betas for every supported version of Ubuntu. It's managed by Scott Ritchie, and is a replacement for the WineHQ budgetdedicated.com repository used for Jaunty and earlier.

OpenOffice.org test packages

PPA for OpenOffice.org Scribblers

KDE 3.5 (1)

This project aims to keep the KDE3.5 computing style alive, as well as polish off any rough edges that were present as of KDE 3.5. Along the way, new useful features will be added to keep the environment up-to-date. IMPORTANT: Both repositories (1 and 2) are required!

KDE 3.5 (2)

This project aims to keep the KDE3.5 computing style alive, as well as polish off any rough edges that were present as of KDE 3.5. Along the way, new useful features will be added to keep the environment up-to-date. IMPORTANT: Both repositories (1 and 2) are required!

Equinox

Equinox and Faenza themes

MKVToolnix

MKVToolnix is a set of tools to create, alter and inspect Matroska files under Linux, other Unices and Windows.

Oracle 10g DB

The Express Edition of the Oracle 10g DB restricted to a single CPU, a maximum of 4 GB of user data and 1 GB of memory

FBReader

FBReader is an ebook reader and permit to browse a large collection of ebooks in several languages

Midori

Midori is a lightweight web browser.

WebKit Team PPA

WebKitGTK+ is the port of the portable web rendering engine WebKit to the GTK+ platform.

Xorg Edgers

Packages for those who think development versions, experimental and unstable are for old ladies. We want our crack straight from upstream git! Well, straight, we want it built and packaged so we don't need to know what we're doing, except that we will break our X and put our computers on fire.

Liferea Stable

Liferea (Linux Feed Reader) is an aggregator for online news feeds. Liferea tries to fill this gap by creating a fast, easy to use, easy to install news aggregator for Gtk/Gnome.

Liferea Unstable

Liferea (Linux Feed Reader) is an aggregator for online news feeds. Liferea tries to fill this gap by creating a fast, easy to use, easy to install news aggregator for Gtk/Gnome.

GCstar

GCstar is a free open source application for managing your collections. Detailed information on each item can be automatically retrieved from the internet and you can store additional data, such as the location or who you've lent it to. You may also search and filter your collection by many criteria.

Epiphany

Epiphany is the web browser for the GNOME desktop. Its goal is to be simple and easy to use. Epiphany ties together many GNOME components in order to let you focus on the Web content, instead of the browser application.

Glx-Dock / Cairo-Dock

Glx-Dock / Cairo-Dock is a Mac-like dock used for applets as well as application launching

MongoDB

MongoDB (from humongous) is a scalable, high-performance, open source, document-oriented database. MongoDB bridges the gap between key-value stores (which are fast and highly scalable) and traditional RDBMS systems (which provide rich queries and deep functionality).

DeaDBeeF

DeaDBeeF - Ultimate Music Player For GNU/Linux

UNetbootin

UNetbootin allows you to create bootable Live USB drives for Ubuntu, Fedora, and other Linux distributions without burning a CD.

Tor Project

Tor is a software project that helps you defend against traffic analysis, a form of network surveillance that threatens personal freedom and privacy, confidential business activities and relationships, and state security. Tor protects you by bouncing your communications around a distributed network of relays run by volunteers all around the world: it prevents somebody watching your Internet connection from learning what sites you visit, and it prevents the sites you visit from learning your physical location. Tor works with many of your existing applications, including web browsers, instant messaging clients, remote login, and other applications based on the TCP protocol.

LibreOffice 3.3

LibreOffice is a productivity suite that is compatible with other major office suites, and available on a variety of platforms. It is free software and therefore free to download, use and distribute.

xNeur

X Neural Switcher - a program to automatically switch the keyboard layouts, according to typed text. That is, when typing, if text dialed in the wrong language, xneur automatically (or upon request) will switch to the desired language.

Gwibber (Daily)

Gwibber is an open source microblogging client for GNOME developed with Python and GTK. It supports Twitter, Identi.ca, StatusNet, Facebook, Flickr, Digg, FriendFeed, and Qaiku. Gwibber daily builds, updates at ~5pm UTC if there are new commits available upstream.

Kubuntu Beta Backports

Backports of beta versions of KDE and major KDE apps.

Opera Beta

Opera is the only Web browser that comes complete with everything you need to be fast, safe and productive online.

GNUzilla and IceCat

GNUzilla is the GNU version of the Mozilla suite, and GNU IceCat is the GNU version of the Firefox browser. Its main advantage is an ethical one: it is entirely free software. While the Firefox source code from the Mozilla project is free software, they distribute and recommend non-free software as plug-ins and addons.

qBittorrent

qBittorrent 2 is a multi-platform Bittorrent client developed in C++/Qt4

Paissad's Repo

Paissad's Personal Repo for PS3 Media-Server

Audacity

Audacity is free, open source software for recording and editing sounds. It is available for Mac OS X, Microsoft Windows, GNU/Linux, and other operating systems.

DeaDBeeF

DeaDBeeF (as in 0xDEADBEEF) is an audio player for GNU/Linux, BSD, OpenSolaris and probably other UNIX-like systems.

Flacon

Flacon extracts individual tracks from one big audio file containing the entire album of music and saves them as separate audio files. To do this, it uses information from the appropriate CUE file.

HandBrake Releases

HandBrake is an open-source, GPL-licensed, multiplatform, multithreaded video transcoder, available for MacOS X, Linux and Windows.

HandBrake Snapshots

HandBrake is an open-source, GPL-licensed, multiplatform, multithreaded video transcoder, available for MacOS X, Linux and Windows.

Paissad's PS3 Media Server Repo

Paissad's Personal Repo for PS3 Media-Server

UbuntuGIS (unstable)

Ubuntu for GIS work

LibreOffice

LibreOffice is a productivity suite that is compatible with other major office suites, and available on a variety of platforms. It is free software and therefore free to download, use and distribute.

Lazarus

Open Source GUI RAD IDE for free Pascal

PlayDeb Beta 2

PlayDeb is an unofficial project with the mission to provide the latest open source and freeware games for the current Ubuntu Linux release, in an easy to install manner. The PlayDeb repository extends the official repositories by providing latest versions and new games. Unlike the official packages, PlayDeb packages do not have a predefined release schedule - new game versions are provided as they become available from their authors.

Cortina

Cortina desktop background editor

Lazarus (Testing)

Open Source GUI RAD IDE for free Pascal

Paissad's PS3 Media Server

Paissad's Personal Repo for PS3 Media-Server

Medibuntu

Medibuntu

Ironhide

Ironhide aims to provide support for NVIDIA Optimus laptops for GNU/Linux distributions. Using Bumblebee, you can use your NVIDIA card for rendering graphics which will be displayed using the Intel card.

Gimp SVN

This is a repository for all of the Gimp trunk git builds that Matt Walker wants. Matt Walker guesses this would be considered a nightly build PPA, but these builds are not build every night automatically rather built whenever Matt Walker get around to it.

Spotify for Linux Preview

Spotify is a music streaming service offering streaming of selected music from a range of major and independent record labels. Spotify for Linux Preview is not officially supported and should be considered of beta-quality.

Unsettings

Unsettings is a graphical configuration program for the Unity desktop environment that lets you change some oft the Unity settings.

PlayDeb

PlayDeb is an unofficial project with the mission to provide the latest open source and freeware games for the current Ubuntu Linux release, in an easy to install manner. The PlayDeb repository extends the official repositories by providing latest versions and new games. Unlike the official packages, PlayDeb packages do not have a predefined release schedule - new game versions are provided as they become available from their authors.

Jupiter

Jupiter is a light weight power and hardware control applet for Linux. It is designed to improve battery life of a portable Linux computer by integrating with the operating system and changing parameters of the computer based on battery or powered connection. Additionally, Jupiter provides quick access to some of the commonly needed hardware controls like screen output and resolution, WIFI, and bluetooth.

Gimp

This is a repository for all of the Gimp trunk git builds that otto06217 wants. Current version in this PPA is GIMP 2.8.0 which also features the Single Window Mode. This works perfectly on Precise.

muCommander (unstable)

muCommander is a lightweight, cross-platform file manager with a dual-pane interface. It runs on any operating system with Java support (Mac OS X, Windows, Linux, *BSD, Solaris...).

Cairo Composite Manager

Cairo Composite Manager is a versatile and extensible composite manager which use cairo for rendering. Plugins can be used to add some cool effects to your desktop.

GNOME3 extra apps

GNOME3 extra apps.

Xfce 4.10

Xfce 4.10 packages for Xubuntu 12.04 LTS (Precise Pangolin).

Google Chrome Browser

Google Chrome runs websites and applications with lightning speed.

Google Earth

Get the world’s geographic information at your fingertips. Take a virtual journey to any location in the world. Explore 3D buildings, imagery, and terrain. Find cities, places and local businesses.

MPlayer Daily Builds

This PPA contains daily builds of mplayer built from svn trunk.

CoreAVC-for-Ubuntu

This PPA is to make setting up and installing coravc-for-linux easier.

SMPlayer2 PPA

This archive contains daily builds of SMPlayer2.

Remastersys

A Unique Linux Backup to Live Media Tool for Debian and Ubuntu

JDownloader PPA

JDownloader is open source, platform independent and written completely in Java. It simplifies downloading files from One-Click-Hosters like Rapidshare.com or Megaupload.com - not only for users with a premium account but also for users who don't pay. It offers downloading in multiple paralell streams, captcha recognition, automatical file extraction and much more. Of course, JDownloader is absolutely free of charge. Additionally, many "link encryption" sites are supported - so you just paste the "encrypted" links and JD does the rest. JDownloader can import CCF, RSDF and the new DLC files.

Dorkfolio Kernel Repository

Ubuntu Kernel Repository following mainline and EOL kernels starting at 3.3.8 featuring BFQ for x86 and x64. They are compiled for desktop usage and not specifically for notebooks. If you install them on a notebook, you’ll notice a huge hit in your battery life with an increase of performance.

Gimp PPA

This is a repository for all of the Gimp trunk git builds that otto06217 wants. Current version in this PPA is GIMP 2.8.0 which also features the Single Window Mode. This works perfectly on Precise.

GNOME3 Extra Apps PPA

GNOME3 extra apps

MPlayer Daily Builds PPA

This PPA contains daily builds of mplayer built from svn trunk.

SABnzbd PPA

SABnzbd is an Open Source Binary Newsreader written in Python. It's totally free, incredibly easy to use, and works practically everywhere.SABnzbd makes Usenet as simple and streamlined as possible by automating everything we can. All you have to do is add an .nzb. SABnzbd takes over from there, where it will be automatically downloaded, verified, repaired, extracted and filed away with zero human interaction.

Xorg Edgers PPA

Packages for those who think development versions, experimental and unstable are for old ladies. We want our crack straight from upstream git! Well, straight, we want it built and packaged so we don't need to know what we're doing, except that we will break our X and put our computers on fire.

Steam for Linux

Steam for Linux is now available in Beta to all users of Steam. With a growing catalog of Linux-supported games and an active Steam for linux community group

Clementine PPA

Clementine is a multiplatform music player. It is inspired by Amarok 1.4, focusing on a fast and easy-to-use interface for searching and playing your music.

WebUpd8 PPA

The main WebUpd8 PPA

WebUpd8 Unstable PPA

This PPA currently holds unreleased / git builds for different applications like Turpial, mc, Audacious.

Oracle Java (JDK) Installer PPA

Oracle Java (JDK) Installer (automatically downloads and installs Oracle JDK6 / JDK7 / JDK8). There are no actual Java files in this PPA.

Kubuntu Backports PPA

Backports of new versions of KDE for Kubuntu which are not yet tested enough to go to Ubuntu Backports.

Midori PPA

Midori is a lightweight web browser.

exFAT PPA

Free exFAT file system implementation for Ubuntu

MATE Desktop Environment

MATE Desktop Environment, a non-intuitive and unattractive desktop for users, using traditional computing desktop metaphor. Also known as the GNOME2 fork.

Unsettings PPA

Unsettings is a graphical configuration program for the Unity desktop environment that lets you change some oft the Unity settings.

Flacon PPA

Flacon extracts individual tracks from one big audio file containing the entire album of music and saves them as separate audio files. To do this, it uses information from the appropriate CUE file.

Pidgin PPA

Pidgin is an easy to use and free chat client used by millions. Connect to AIM, MSN, Yahoo, and more chat networks all at once. Supported chat networks: * AIM * Bonjour * Gadu-Gadu * Google Talk * Groupwise * ICQ * IRC * MSN * MySpaceIM * QQ * SILC * SIMPLE * Sametime * XMPP * Yahoo! * Zephyr

Ubuntu Tweak PPA

Ubuntu Tweak is an application designed to config Ubuntu easier for everyone. It provides many useful desktop and system options that are not provided in the default desktop environment. At present, it is only designed for Ubuntu GNOME Desktop.

HandBrake Snapshots PPA

HandBrake is an open-source, GPL-licensed, multiplatform, multithreaded video transcoder, available for MacOS X, Linux and Windows.

Xfce 4.10 PPA

Xfce 4.10 packages for Xubuntu 12.04 LTS (Precise Pangolin).

Weather Indicator PPA

Nice-looking weather indicator in system tray

Samsung Unified Linux Driver Repository (SULDR)

Unified Linux Driver for Samsung printers and scanners.

Cinnamon Stable PPA

Cinnamon is a user interface. It is a fork of GNOME Shell, initially developed by (and for) Linux Mint. It provides a usable user environment based on the desktop metaphor, like GNOME 2.

Banshee PPA

This PPA contains the latest debs of Banshee for Ubuntu.

Kubuntu Beta Backports PPA

Backports of beta versions of KDE and major KDE apps.

Kubuntu Experimental PPA

Testing ground for unfinished Kubuntu packages - use with caution!

Kubuntu Updates PPA

Updates for Kubuntu releases which are due to go to Ubuntu Updates. Mostly KDE point releases.

LibreOffice PPA

LibreOffice is a productivity suite that is compatible with other major office suites, and available on a variety of platforms. It is free software and therefore free to download, use and distribute.

Mozilla Daily Build Team PPA

This PPA contains daily builds (or even multiple builds per day) for various mozilla projects and branches. Notably: Firefox, Prism, Thunderbird and Xulrunner.

UNetbootin PPA

UNetbootin allows you to create bootable Live USB drives for Ubuntu, Fedora, and other Linux distributions without burning a CD.

Wine PPA

Wine is an Open Source implementation of the Windows API on top of X, OpenGL, and Unix. With this PPA you can get the latest available Wine betas for every supported version of Ubuntu. It's managed by Scott Ritchie, and is a replacement for the WineHQ budgetdedicated.com repository used for Jaunty and earlier.

Plex Media Center

Plex Media Center bridges the gap between your computer and your home theater, doing so with a visually appealing user interface that provides instant access to your media.

Boot-Repair PPA

Boot-Repair is a simple tool to repair frequent boot issues you may encounter in Ubuntu like when you can't boot Ubuntu after installing Windows or another Linux distribution, or when you can't boot Windows after installing Ubuntu, or when GRUB is not displayed anymore, some upgrade breaks GRUB, etc.

Steam for Linux

Steam for Linux is now available. With a growing catalog of Linux-supported games and an active Steam for linux community group

Highly Explosive PPA

Every photographer needs some tools. Packages with the latest graphics software, absent in other PPA.

X Updates PPA

Updated versions of X.org drivers, libraries, etc. for Ubuntu. This PPA is for stable upstream releases of X.org components.

BitTorrent Sync

BitTorrent Sync lets you sync and share files and folders between devices, friends, and coworkers. Available for Windows, Mac, Linux, iOS, and Android.

SwissSign

Smartcard Software for Linux for SuisseID provided by Die Post and QuoVadis and others.

Spotify for Linux

Spotify is a music streaming service offering streaming of selected music from a range of major and independent record labels. Spotify for Linux Preview is not officially supported and should be considered of beta-quality.

Equinox PPA

Equinox and Faenza themes

Claws Mail PPA

Claws Mail is a user-friendly, lightweight, and fast email client. it is based on GTK+ and the appearance and interface are designed to be familiar to new users coming from other popular email clients, as well as experienced users. Almost all commands are accessible with the keyboard. Claws Mail has lots of extra functionality, like an RSS aggregator, calendar, or laptop LED handling, are provided by extra plugins.

SimpleScreenRecorder PPA

SimpleScreenRecorder is a feature-rich screen recorder that supports X11 and OpenGL. It has a Qt-based graphical user interface. It can record the entire screen or part of it, or record OpenGL applications directly. The recording can be paused and resumed at any time. Many different file formats and codecs are supported.

Boomaga PPA

Boomaga (BOOklet MAnager) is a virtual printer for viewing a document before printing it out using the physical printer. The program is very simple to work with. Running any program, click “print” and select “Boomaga” to see in several seconds (CUPS takes some time to respond) the Boomaga window open. If you print out one more document, it gets added to the previous one, and you can also print them out as one.

ownCloud Desktop Client

With ownCloud you can sync & share your files, calendar, contacts and more. Access your data from all your devices, on an open platform you can extend and modify.

MariaDB

MariaDB is a drop-in replacement for MySQL. MariaDB strives to be the logical choice for database professionals looking for a robust, scalable, and reliable SQL server. To accomplish this, the MariaDB Foundation work closely and cooperatively with the larger community of users and developers in the true spirit of Free and open source software, and release software in a manner that balances predictability with reliability.

Dropbox PPA

This is the Repo for the dropbox paket direct from the Dropbox website.

MEGA Sync Client

Easy automated syncing between your computers and your MEGA cloud drive.

Daniil's Bash Video Download

Repo for video-dl, a bash video download script

Spotify

Spotify beta client for linux

Daniil's repo

Repo for video-dl download script

SublimeText 3

Sublime Text is a sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose. You'll love the slick user interface, extraordinary features and amazing performance.

Subversion 1.9 PPA

Updated versions of the Subversion version control system

Virtualmin

Virtualmin is a powerful and flexible web hosting control panel for Linux and BSD systems. Available in an Open Source community-supported version, and a more feature-filled version with premium support, Virtualmin is the cost-effective and comprehensive solution to virtual web hosting management. And, Virtualmin is the most popular and most comprehensive Open Source control panel with over 100,000 installations worldwide.

Back in Time

Back In Time is a simple backup tool for Linux inspired from “flyback project” and “TimeVault”. The backup is done by taking snapshots of a specified set of directories.

Syncthing

Syncthing replaces proprietary sync and cloud services with something open, trustworthy and decentralized. Your data is your data alone and you deserve to choose where it is stored, if it is shared with some third party and how it's transmitted over the Internet.

Sonarr

Sonarr is a PVR for Usenet and BitTorrent users. It can monitor multiple RSS feeds for new episodes of your favorite shows and will grab, sort and rename them. It can also be configured to automatically upgrade the quality of files already downloaded when a better quality format becomes available.

Geary

Geary is an email application built around conversations, for the GNOME 3 desktop. It allows you to read, find and send email with a straightforward, modern interface.

Vocal PPA

Vocal, a simple and beautiful podcast app for Linux desktop

Spotify (testing)

Spotify testing client for linux

JDownloader PPA

JDownloader is open source, platform independent and written completely in Java. It simplifies downloading files from One-Click-Hosters like Rapidshare.com or Megaupload.com - not only for users with a premium account but also for users who don't pay. It offers downloading in multiple paralell streams, captcha recognition, automatical file extraction and much more. Of course, JDownloader is absolutely free of charge. Additionally, many "link encryption" sites are supported - so you just paste the "encrypted" links and JD does the rest. JDownloader can import CCF, RSDF and the new DLC files.§

Geary PPA

Geary is an email application built around conversations, for the GNOME 3 desktop. It allows you to read, find and send email with a straightforward, modern interface.
